It's the annual Monarch Butterfly migration from Canada

The butterfly reserve is located about three
hours west of Mexico City. It's actually
a giant park. There are 4 or 5 sanctuaries
you can visit, all of which hug the
border between the state of Mexico and
the state of Michoacan. You can do a
day trip, or you can stay in the town of
Angangueo.
Either way plug Angangueo into your GPS because
the two most popular sanctuaries are
just a few kilometers away.
Alright, so we've begun the ascent
to the top of Sierra Chincua, which is the second
most famous sanctuary here in
the Michoacán State.
The park itself is many many many different sites.
It's a big forest, and this one,
apparently, is one of the nicer ones in Michoacan.
It's 3,300 meters above sea level,
which means it's about 1000 meters
above the altitude of Mexico City
